name: MLCEmbeddingDescriptor
desc: A configuration object you use to create an embedding layer.

items.name: init?(embeddingCount: Int, embeddingDimension: Int)
items.desc: Creates an embedding descriptor with the size of the dictionary and dimension of embedding vectors you specify.

items.name: init?(embeddingCount: Int, embeddingDimension: Int, paddingIndex: Int?, maximumNorm: Float?, pNorm: Float?, scalesGradientByFrequency: Bool)
items.desc: Creates an embedding descriptor with the size and dimension of embedding vectors, padding index, and norm and scaling options that you specify.

items.name: var paddingIndex: Int?
items.desc: An unsigned integer value that, if set, causes the layer to initialize the embedding vector at that index to zero.

items.name: var maximumNorm: Float?
items.desc: A float value that, if set, causes the layer to renormalize the selected embedding vectors to have an Lp norm less than this value.

items.name: var pNorm: Float?
items.desc: The p of the Lp norm.

items.name: var scalesGradientByFrequency: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean that indicates whether the layer scales gradients by the inverse of the frequency of words in batch before the weight update.
